content: increase/ d - increase/d ws - wrong side k - knit k2tog - knit 2 stitches together as one 1 stitch decreased m1l - make one increase that leans to the left by picking up the thread between two stitches from in front and knitting the new stitch twisted through the back loop m1r - make one increase that leans to the right by picking up the thread between two stitches from behind and knitting the new stitch normally p - purl pm - place marker repeat - repeat rm - remove marker 3 all images illustrations and text © bare knit the knitting club sweater - notes - ‣ this sweater is worked from the top ‣ the ribbing needle is only used in the down seamlessly the sleeve sts are put collar of the sweater all the rest ribbing on hold while the body is finished and is knitted with the main fabric needle then returned to the needle you can this is done to make the bottom of the easily modify the length of body and sweater and the sleeves less fitted if you sleeves do take into account that prefer more fitted look use the ribbing modifications will affect yardage that is needle in all the ribbing areas required a complete video tutorial for this pattern -
